data.description:
NEW! Start creating beautiful paintings right away with the paint-by-numbers packs, or generate paint-by-numbers templates from your own photos. Painting has never been more accessible!

It’s time to discover your inner artist! With Vermillion, you get a fully equipped oil painting studio in your home, without any of the mess. Ready for the unrivaled sense of accomplishment of hanging your first painting in your living room? Start painting right away with the paint-by-numbers packs, learn with your favorite YouTube artists using the built-in web browser, or even better - learn to paint from (new) friends in multiplayer!

Features:
- Realistic color mixing simulation
- Wide range of oil painting brushes
- Adjustable color blending on the canvas
- Satisfyingly thick oil paint that can be shaped three dimensionally
- Undo/redo, re-orderable layers
- Paint by numbers packs and generator
- In-game browser including canvas projector
- Local file support for reference photos
- Frame & mount your paintings in your own home or in VR
- Four player online multiplayer
- Co-located multiplayer in mixed reality
- Three virtual studio environments and mixed reality mode
- Easy image export

Artwork in the screenshots by Gladski, Chad Munn and Mistkinya.

changelog.change_log: There are now premade paint-by-numbers packs so you can get started with painting without even thinking about it!

- You can now generate a paint by numbers template from your own images and any image you find online! Vermillion will generate the outlines, which you can show above or below the paint on the canvas. The palette will be automatically filled with the required colors. You can isolate outlines to one color at a time, so you can very easily apply the right color in the right area. Painting has never been more accessible!
- You can now open files you copied to your Quest over USB, instead of only online. Paint by numbers can also be generated from local images.
- Reduced memory usage which makes the app more stable on Quest 3, especially in multiplayer.
- Fixed a bug where for lefties, your hands could swap if you paused the game and resumed.
- Fixed keyboard sometimes not being complete.
Fixed Room setup in passthrough not working correctly, leading to an invisible wall in front of the easel.

- Fixed the projector slightly resizing over time.

Fixed lighting in the loft studio. Previous update:

Improved locomotion! Holding trigger will enable the locomotion mode, showing a panel with the options you have. 

- Teleport is now an arc instead of a straight line.
- Teleport now lets you set the target rotation directly using the thumbstick.
- Teleport now always puts you exactly where you teleported to.
- Added snap, quick, and smooth rotation.
- Added head & controller aimed smooth locomotion.
- Added grab locomotion, allowing you to position yourself by "dragging" the world around. Perfect for positioning yourself just right.
- You can now move in the entire studio environment, instead of only in the blue area.

- Changed mountain lake studio sky.

- Precise brush haptics on Quest Pro.
- Eye tracked foveated rendering on Quest Pro.
- Local dimming on Quest Pro.
- Avatars are a bit less bright, since they were popping too much.

- Added Oculus multiplayer functionality! You can now invite friends directly into Vermillion's multiplayer using the friends & party UI.
- You can now report abusive players. 
- When trying to join a public room and none is available, you now automatically create a public room yourself so others can join later.
- Fixed player moving when going in and out of multiplayer.
- Fixed issue with layered transparent paint. Only applies to new paintings.
- Added "Merge" label on layer merge button for clarity.
- Made the easel less heavy to move around.
- Changed the way thick paint is applied, so you can't get overly thick paint from going over the same bit twice.
